episodeTitle: The End of the Legendary Man! The Day the Sea Train Cried!
episodeTitleJapanese: 伝説の男の最期！海列車が泣いた日
episodeTitleRomanized: Densetsu no otoko no saigo! Umi ressha ga naita hi
description: In a devastating flashback, Tom's Workers face arrest after being framed for attacking a judicial ship. Tom takes responsibility to save his apprentices, but Franky's rage leads him to attack Spandam, resulting in Tom being taken to Enies Lobby. Franky attempts to stop the Sea Train with his bare hands, leading to a tragic collision that nearly kills him.

events.title: Tom's Workers Framed by CP5
events.description: Eight years in the past, Spandam and CP5 frame Tom, Franky, and Iceburg by using Franky's Battle Franky warships to attack a judicial ship, making it appear that Tom's Workers orchestrated the attack to escape Tom's original death sentence.
events.significance: This event reveals the conspiracy that led to Tom's execution and Franky's transformation into a cyborg. It establishes Spandam as a manipulative antagonist willing to frame innocent people to achieve his goals of obtaining the Pluton blueprints.

quotes.text: Tom and his workers are the ones who attacked the judicial ship!
quotes.speaker: Spandam
quotes.context: Spandam falsely accuses Tom's Workers of the attack he orchestrated

events.title: Tom Punches Franky and Teaches Him Pride
events.description: When Franky expresses shame that his ships were used as weapons, Tom punches him for the first time, teaching him that a shipwright must take pride in their creations no matter how they are used. Tom declares that there are no good or evil ships, only good or evil men who use them.
events.significance: This is Tom's most important lesson to Franky and defines Franky's philosophy as a shipwright for the rest of his life. It's a pivotal character development moment that establishes the theme of taking responsibility and pride in one's work, which becomes central to Franky's character and his later relationship with the Thousand Sunny.

quotes.text: Don't ever say that about the ships you built! A ship is neither good nor evil. It doesn't matter what you equip it with, it doesn't matter what kind of ship it is! A shipwright shouldn't be ashamed of the ship he built!
quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.context: Tom's passionate lesson to Franky about taking pride in one's creations

quotes.text: The ship isn't at fault. The men who use it are!
quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.context: Tom's philosophy on responsibility and craftsmanship

events.title: Tom's Ultimate Sacrifice
events.description: Tom tells Judge Jorge that he will accept the death penalty for both his original crime of building the Oro Jackson for Gol D. Roger and the false accusation of attacking the judicial ship. He asks that Franky and Iceburg be pardoned and not taken to Enies Lobby, sacrificing himself to save his apprentices.
events.significance: This is the climactic moment of Tom's character arc, demonstrating his unconditional love for his apprentices and his willingness to die to protect them. It also shows Tom's pride in having built Roger's ship, refusing to show regret even though it cost him his life. This sacrifice deeply impacts both Franky and Iceburg for the rest of their lives.

quotes.text: I'll take responsibility for everything! I built a ship for the Pirate King, and I'm proud of it! I'll accept my punishment!
quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.context: Tom accepting his fate while expressing pride in his greatest work

events.title: Franky Attacks Spandam
events.description: Overcome with rage at Spandam for framing them and taking Tom away, Franky grabs a pistol from a Marine guard and brutally attacks Spandam, smashing him in the face with the gun and permanently disfiguring him. This act of violence turns Franky into a wanted criminal despite Tom's sacrifice.
events.significance: This violent outburst marks a turning point for Franky, transforming him from a relatively innocent apprentice into a fugitive. The disfigurement of Spandam's face creates a lasting grudge that affects their future encounters. It also demonstrates Franky's fierce loyalty and inability to control his emotions when those he loves are harmed.

quotes.text: You bastard! This is all your fault!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky's rage-filled accusation before attacking Spandam

events.title: Franky Attempts to Stop the Sea Train
events.description: Franky positions himself on the tracks in front of the Puffing Tom, attempting to stop the Sea Train with his bare hands to prevent it from taking Tom to Enies Lobby and his execution. He fires weapons at the train and uses all his strength, but the train runs him over.
events.significance: This desperate act shows Franky's love for Tom and his willingness to die to save his mentor. It's the event that nearly kills him and forces him to rebuild himself as a cyborg, fundamentally changing who he is. The tragedy of being run over by Tom's own creation (the Sea Train) adds poetic tragedy to the moment.

quotes.text: Puffing Tom! Don't take your creator away! Stop!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky's desperate plea to the Sea Train before being run over

events.title: Franky Hit by Sea Train
events.description: The Puffing Tom runs over Franky, catastrophically injuring his body. He is left for dead on the tracks with massive injuries that would kill a normal person. This incident forces him to later rebuild himself as a cyborg using scrap metal and ship parts to survive.
events.significance: This is the transformative event that turns Franky from a human into a cyborg. The severe injuries sustained here necessitate his self-modification and explain his unique appearance and abilities. It's a symbolic death of his old self and the birth of the Franky we know in the present timeline.

events.title: Present Day: Spandam Confronts Franky
events.description: Back in the present timeline, Spandam reveals himself to Franky and CP9, showing that he has been promoted from CP5 to CP9 chief. He still bears the scars from Franky's attack eight years ago and recognizes his old enemy.
events.significance: This moment connects the flashback to the present storyline, showing that the conflict between Franky and Spandam remains unresolved. It sets up the coming confrontation and reveals that Spandam has risen in power while still seeking revenge and the Pluton blueprints.

quotes.text: Long time no see, Cutty Flam. Or should I call you Franky now?
quotes.speaker: Spandam
quotes.context: Spandam revealing himself to Franky in the present day

events.title: Flashback Begins: Eight Years Ago
events.description: The episode transitions into an extended flashback showing events from eight years in the past, when Franky was 26 years old and still working as Tom's apprentice alongside Iceburg.
events.significance: This flashback provides crucial context for understanding Franky's character, his relationship with Tom and Iceburg, and the events that shaped his current persona. It's one of the most emotionally powerful backstories in One Piece.

themes.description: Tom willingly accepts execution to save his apprentices, demonstrating the ultimate parental sacrifice. His death haunts Franky and drives his actions throughout the Water 7 arc.
themes.symbolism: Tom's sacrifice represents the burden mentors bear for their students' mistakes and the debt of gratitude that can never be fully repaid.

themes.description: Tom's central philosophy that craftsmen must take pride in their creations regardless of how others use them is the episode's defining theme. This lesson shapes Franky's entire worldview.
themes.symbolism: The ships represent the creations we bring into the world - we must own them with pride even when they cause harm.

themes.description: Franky's inability to control his anger leads to him attacking Spandam, which undermines Tom's sacrifice and results in Franky becoming a wanted criminal. His subsequent attempt to stop the train nearly kills him.
themes.symbolism: Franky being run over by Tom's creation symbolizes how his rage and impulsiveness betrayed Tom's teachings and legacy.

themes.description: The episode exposes the World Government's willingness to frame innocent people to achieve their goals, with Spandam representing corrupt authority willing to sacrifice others for personal gain.
themes.symbolism: The judicial ship attack represents how those in power manipulate justice itself to serve their interests.

characterSpotlights.development: Tom's final moments show his unconditional love for his apprentices and his unwavering pride in his work. He accepts death without regret, standing by his decision to build Roger's ship and choosing to save Franky and Iceburg even at the cost of his own life.

characterSpotlights.development: Young Franky experiences the most traumatic event of his life. We see him transform from a cocky shipwright to someone consumed by guilt and rage. His attack on Spandam and attempt to stop the train show his fierce loyalty but also his inability to accept Tom's sacrifice, leading to his near-death and transformation into a cyborg.

characterSpotlights.development: Spandam is revealed as a manipulative and cruel agent willing to frame innocent people to get what he wants. His desire for the Pluton blueprints drives him to orchestrate the attack on the judicial ship. When Franky attacks him, his face is permanently disfigured, creating a lasting grudge.

characterSpotlights.development: Iceburg witnesses the destruction of his mentor and father figure. His helplessness during these events and his later role in trying to protect the Pluton blueprints are established through this traumatic experience.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends several emotional moments with additional reaction shots and extended pauses that are not present in the manga, particularly during Tom's speech about pride and Franky being hit by the train.
The anime adds more detail to the visual of the Puffing Tom running over Franky, showing the impact and aftermath more graphically than the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode is considered one of the most emotional episodes in the Water 7 arc and in One Piece overall. Tom's sacrifice and Franky's tragedy are frequently cited as one of the series' most heartbreaking backstories.

The ending theme 'Dear Friends' by TRIPLANE is dedicated to the Going Merry and plays during this arc as the ship's fate parallels Tom's sacrifice - both being creations that gave everything for their crews.
This episode adapts portions of manga chapters 356, 357, and 358, covering roughly 2.5 chapters worth of content.
The scene where Tom punches Franky is the only time Tom ever struck his apprentice, making it particularly impactful and memorable.
Episode 250 aired on November 27, 2005, in Japan, which was during the peak popularity of the Water 7 arc in the anime.
